text: More than 3.6 million youth are using e-cigarettes, specifically disposable devices. RT @SenTedCruz Enough with Democrats’ partisan games. There's work that needs to be done to get America on the path to recovery, people safely back to work, & kids back to school. Instead of political posturing, Dems need to step up & do their jobs. The American people deserve nothing less.

Last week, my colleagues and I sent a letter to the @USDOT & FAA urging them to initiate crucial workforce grant programs to create workforce training & job opportunities for the aviation industry. In March, we worked together on an overwhelmingly bipartisan basis to deliver emergency relief for the American people.

What’s changed since then?

We’re much closer to Election Day, and Democrats have decided it's in their political interest not to cut a deal. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1304063348921819137/img/S4fGwSQjLaDkCH6D.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1304063348921819137/vid/480x270/LneqtHnLawG8Kuk4.mp4?tag=13

Our economy was booming back in January. We can get back to that, but not if governments continue mandating that everything stay shut down.

That’s why I introduced the RECOVERY Act, which lays out common-sense steps we can and must take to get our economy moving again. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1304055430637912065/img/FdguLwJgMSQxpIlI.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1304055430637912065/vid/480x270/o3AD2mBGI5NisF7q.mp4?tag=13

Big Tech companies like Google, Amazon, Facebook, & Apple have way too much power over our economy & our democracy. For the good of our country, we must demand our regulators do their jobs & take swift, aggressive action – not kick the can down the road one more time.

The case against Google is clear. We can’t let a desperate and reckless Attorney General undermine @TheJusticeDept’s case. But we also can’t let Big Tech’s army of lawyers, lobbyists, & consultants use Barr as an excuse to wriggle out of the law.

I’ve spent years calling out @TheJusticeDept for refusing to enforce antitrust laws – including against Google. There’s no question that DOJ should’ve done something about Google’s consolidation long ago. The real question is what’s taking them so long. https://www.vox.com/2016/7/4/12077568/elizabeth-warren-antitrust

Google uses its size to bully competitors, snuffing them out with mergers & demoting their products. We must hold Google accountable & #BreakUpBigTech. That means allowing @TheJusticeDept’s antitrust investigation to continue without political interference.https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/03/us/politics/google-antitrust-justice-department.html

I’m proud to join @SenMarkey, @RepDebHaaland, and our colleagues in introducing the THRIVE Agenda to fight for climate justice, a real relief package, and investment in Black, Brown, and Indigenous communities. #TimeToThrive
https://www.theverge.com/2020/9/10/21430616/democrats-thrive-agenda-economy-pandemic-racism-climate-change-resolution-congress

Donald Trump has made it very clear: The fate of our democracy is on the line in this election. Everything we’ve fought for since he took office comes down to the next few weeks.

And our work doesn’t end in November. The solutions we advocate for now will have a lasting impact.
The climate crisis is an existential threat—and we’re running out of time to act. Our planet can’t survive four more years of Donald Trump’s denial and sabotage.

Donald Trump’s magical thinking won’t solve the health and economic crisis that hardworking families are facing.

We need real leadership to get out of the mess he and his Republican enablers have put us in. That’s @KamalaHarris and @JoeBiden.
https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/09/10/910724801/yukis-narrative-rich-overview-of-poll-data-on-pandemics-damage
It’s long past time for Republicans in Congress to step up to their responsibility, set politics aside, and put the health and economic well-being of the American people first.
